next_steps: Set up the on-device evaluation harness for Android phones and Raspberry Pi/Jetson Nano, ensuring it can accurately measure latency and energy consumption per inference.
Obtain and partition the Fakeddit and NewsCLIPpings datasets into training, validation, and testing sets as specified.

Train and evaluate the unimodal baseline models (text-only DistilBERT and image-only MobileNetV3) on the partitioned datasets to establish initial performance metrics and validate the evaluation pipeline.
parsed.justification: This response provides concrete, sequenced steps that directly address the research plan's initial phase, respecting my resource constraints and clearly outlining what needs to be done in the next few days.

next_steps: Check access to A100/L40 or 3090 GPUs for training, or identify alternative cloud/uni resources if unavailable
Download and preprocess Fakeddit dataset subsets to fit local storage, verifying label integrity and modality alignment
Set up basic PyTorch environment on a mid-tier Android phone or Raspberry Pi for initial latency profiling of DistilBERT text-only inference
parsed.justification: The plan is technically clear but assumes high-end GPUs and omits immediate steps for resource verification, making it hard to start practically within 1–3 days despite good pitfall awareness.

next_steps: Download and partition Fakeddit and NewsCLIPpings datasets into train/val/test splits using provided references.
Set up PyTorch environment and train simple text-only DistilBERT and image-only MobileNetV3 baselines on a personal laptop or free Colab, focusing on initial accuracy metrics.
Profile latency and energy on my available mid-tier Android phone using Android BatteryStats, and share device specs (SoC, OS) for refining targets.
parsed.justification: As a student with limited time and compute, this plan gives me a clear starting point with datasets I can download quickly and simple baselines I can run on my laptop or phone without needing fancy hardware right away, reducing my uncertainty about where to begin. It respects my constraints by emphasizing lightweight models and on-device testing, making me feel confident to tackle Month 1 steps in the next few days.
